paper.title: CAN DIFFERENT LEARNING PATHS PRODUCE BETTER ESTIMATES IN EMPIRICAL ASSET PRICING VIA MACHINE LEARNING?
paper.abstract: This paper demonstrates how a portfolio composition technique can leverage the power of machine learning approaches in empirical asset pricing, using a very large set of identical Neural Networks (NN) and differentiating them only by the initial set of parameters. We implement the portfolio employing a trivial rule of ensemble, demonstrating how the variety generated by the initial conditions of the Neural Networks can produce better results than the average. This approach shed a new light on the potential application of ensemble methods to outperform a single NN involved in portfolio construction strategies, using more complex rules to extract the information discovered by the different training paths of identical NN.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要探讨了如何利用机器学习方法（特别是神经网络和集成方法）来改进资产定价和投资组合构建策略，这直接关联到投资组合管理领域。
